body:
Comment 9: 
I tried running your batch file from command line. It does appear to return 0 all the
time regardless:

C:\>test.bat 0 && echo "Zero result"
"Zero result"

C:\>test.bat 1 && echo "Zero result"
"Zero result"

C:\>test.bat 0 || echo "Non-zero result"

C:\>test.bat 1 || echo "Non-zero result"

C:\>

It looks to me that cmd.exe always see 0 exit code. That is what current os.StartProcess
does. Isn't it?

I think there are too many "tricky" things to make it work simple and clear. I think
people should avoid using batch files when they can. If you can't avoid batch file, then
you still have an option to use os.StartProcess with appropriate parameters, but then at
least you supposed to know what you are doing.

Alex
